values.value: GDPR Article 5(1)(c) requires personal data to be adequate, relevant, and limited to what is necessary for the purposes for which they are processed. Organizations must implement access controls to ensure users only access personal data necessary for their role.

1. Review all permission sets and profiles for excessive access to personal data. 2. Implement field-level security to restrict access to sensitive personal data fields. 3. Remove "View All Data" and "Modify All Data" permissions except for system administrators. 4. Create role-based permission sets with minimal necessary access. 5. Conduct quarterly access reviews to ensure data minimization compliance. 6. Document business justification for any broad access to personal data.
